pr_title: [CAMEL-15725] setting up basic OSGi-CDI metadata in the manifest

timeline.message: setting up basic OSGi-CDI metadata in the manifest

timeline.bodyText:
IIRC, we did not used the @Vetoed annotation to maintain compatibility with CDI 1.0.
It works because the default profile weld-3.0 uses CDI 2.0, but other profiles may fail.
That being said, we may want to consider dropping CDI 1.0 support.
timeline.author: astefanutti

replies.bodyText: It does not break CDI 1.0 compatibility since it does not add more beans. Will just enable aries-cdi to drop the beans early and does not affect OWB/Weld/Arc.
replies.author: rmannibucau

replies.bodyText: @rmannibucau can you confirm mvn test -Powb-1.0 passes?
replies.author: astefanutti

replies.bodyText:
Indeed it does not but not because of @Vetoed, because it was compiled with cdi 2.0 API (bean attributes) so binary is not CDI 1.0 compatible. See org.apache.camel.cdi.CdiCamelBeanRepository#findByTypeWithName which uses javax.enterprise.inject.spi.BeanAttributes#getName for a single example.
side note for that: pom setup breaks multiimpl setup for java > 8 (java 9 profile forces weld).
replies.author: rmannibucau

replies.bodyText: Wow, I see. It's aeecbc4 that changed the compilation from using CDI 1.0 to CDI 2.0, and broke binary compatibility as the Bean interface changed its hierarchy to use the new BeanAttributes interface. So CDI 1.0 compatibility got broken starting Camel 3.0. AFAIK, nobody has ever complained so it may be a good empirical test to considered dropping support safe.
replies.author: astefanutti
